intro: Micranthella confertiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered micranthella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided leaves, typical of the carrot family. The plant produces numerous tiny white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense umbels, which give it its common name. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical structure supports its role as a herbaceous plant with a short life cycle.
